Generate PSMatrixList from Background data and JASPAR Matrix

Source: R/Build_Background.R
generate_psmatrixlist_from_background.Rd

This function retrieves background data for a specified organism and promoter region, and then fetches a corresponding matrix set from a specified JASPAR version. It returns a `PSMatrixList` object with background statistics.

generate_psmatrixlist_from_background(
  JASPAR_matrix,
  org,
  prom_reg,
  assembly = character()
)

Arguments

JASPAR_matrix

A character string specifying the JASPAR database version. You can choose between 'JASPAR2020', 'JASPAR2022', or 'JASPAR2024' (non case sensitive).

org

A string representing the organism acronym. Accepted values are: `hs` (Homo sapiens), `mm` (Mus musculus), `at` (Arabidopsis thaliana), `sc` (Saccharomyces cerevisiae), `dm` (Drosophila melanogaster).

prom_reg

A numeric vector of two integers as `[upstream, downstream]` representing the promoter region relative to the TSS. Allowed combinations:

  • 200 base pairs upstream and 50 downstream base pair from the TSS (c(-200, 50))

  • 450 bp upstream and 50 downstream (c(-450, 50))

  • 500 bp upstream and 0 downstream (c(-500, 0))

  • 950 bp upstream and 50 downstream (c(-950, 50))

  • 1000 bp upstream and 0 downstream (c(-1000, 0))

assembly

A string representing the assembly version for Human or mouse. For `"hs"` you can choose between `"hg38"` or the latest `"hs1"`. For `"mm"` you can specify `"mm10"` or `"mm39"`. Default is character().

Value

A `PSMatrixList` object with background-scored motif matrices.

Details

The background files are downloaded from the GitHub repository: https://github.com/dianabetelli/PscanR_backgrounds This function automatically fetches the appropriate background file and combines it with the specified JASPAR matrix collection to create a `PSMatrixList` with background statistics.

Examples

bg_matrices <- generate_psmatrixlist_from_background('Jaspar2020', 'hs', 
                                                     c(-200,50), 'hg38')
bg_matrices
#> PSMatrixList of length 746
#> names(746): MA0004.1 MA0006.1 MA0019.1 MA0029.1 ... MA0748.2 MA0528.2 MA0609.2
bg_matrices[[4]]
#> An object of class PSMatrix
#> ID: MA0029.1
#> Name: Mecom
#> Matrix Class: C2H2 zinc finger factors
